intro: Campanula brachysepala, commonly known as the broad-sepaled bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and the species is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Campanula brachysepala is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardiness.
